intro: Diplycosia schramii, commonly known as the Schram's diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
